Articles.Content:
I've been running into some issues with trying to capture a class E asteroid around kerbin, using the same technique and ship that I previously used for a class D: rendezvous ~20 days before it enters kerbin's SOI, grab on and align with its center of mass, adjust its course to aerocapture.  When I came in to aerocapture with basically the same velocity as the class D had done fine with (~3100m/s), it was basically as if the asteroid wasn't even there. Parts started exploding at 60km, and by the time i reached 40km, everything was gone.  Tried it a few times with different heights, but it didn't make any difference.

At that point I basically accepted that it was never going to aerocapture, so set it up to do a simple braking burn at a higher periapsis. That just led me to a different even stranger issue, with the asteroid basically not existing when i start to burn, no matter how low my throttle is.  It would clip my ship about halfway into the asteroid, then both my ship and the asteroid go up into a giant fireball. Have tried different braking maneuvers, but it seems like nothing works at all once I'm inside Kerbin's SOI.  

So at this point I'm pretty much stumped, is there anything different I can try, or something that needs to be fixed in the save file perhaps?

That is interesting. It was my impression that no asteroids of any size provide aero shielding. But it sounds like your class D ones did. Odd.

You should definitely take the thing a little ways down into the atmosphere for the enhanced Oberth, if for no other reason. But keep things retrograde, not prograde.

The clipping thing is obviously a bug. I've never seen that happen myself. If you downloaded your program from steam, it might be wise to verify your install.

5 hours ago, Zephyrus said:

So at this point I'm pretty much stumped, is there anything different I can try, or something that needs to be fixed in the save file perhaps?

In my experience, asteroids are rather bug-ridden things.  They don't like being put in atmospheres and the really don't like being reverted.  My own self, I capture them on thrust alone to avoid these issues.
